Column Comment.0: UNIT OF MEASURE IDENTIFIER: A unique set of characters used to symbolize theunit concisely. Note these can use upper and lower case. For example, s (second),kg (kilogram). This value is a natural key value created to provide uniqueness. In thecase of the sample data, they may not reflect the usage of the referfence source.
Column Comment.1: UNIT OF MEASURE IDENTIFIER: A unique set of characters used to symbolize theunit concisely. Note these can use upper and lower case. For example, s (second),kg (kilogram). This value is a natural key value created to provide uniqueness. In thecase of the sample data, they may not reflect the usage of the referfence source.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.4: EXACT CONVERSION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether the conversion isexact. An N indicator indicates that the conversion is not exact.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: NUMBERIC DENOMINATOR:: ((From_Unit_Name + Pre_Offset ) *factor_Numerator/Factor_Denominator)) + Post_Offset == To_Unit_Name
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE DOCUMENT: the document from which this reference information wasobtained.
Column Comment.14: The value used in the computation of the conversion. Typically a value to use in amultiplication operation.
Column Comment.15: UNIT QUANTITY: The quantity or type that applies to the conversion pair.Denormalized from PPDM UNIT OF MEASURE.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
